feed.title: Depledge Lab
feed.subtitle: DepledgeLab focuses on understanding how human herpesviruses persist following infection and how this is influenced by different aspects of RNA biology. Here, exciting web-lab, high performance computing bioinformatics and supportive colleagues meet to create new research.

entry.title: Introducing our new visiting researcher, Dr. Amy Fitzpatrick

link.title: Introducing our new visiting researcher, Dr. Amy Fitzpatrick

entry.content: Twitter might currently resemble a dumpster fire but without it we never would not have connected with Amy who is now spending two months in the Depledge Lab to provide expert bioinformatics support to several ongoing Oxford Nanopore Technology-based projects underway in the lab.
entry.summary: Twitter might currently resemble a dumpster fire but without it we never would not have connected with Amy who is now spending two months in the Depledge Lab to provide expert bioinformatics support to several ongoing Oxford Nanopore Technology-based projects underway in the lab.

entry.title: Training the next generation of scientists

link.title: Training the next generation of scientists

entry.content: We are always excited to host and hopefully inspire the next generation of scientists. Ella Gripp was the latest visitor to our lab, learning the inns and outs of nanopore sequencing under the careful guidance of Ruth.
entry.summary: We are always excited to host and hopefully inspire the next generation of scientists. Ella Gripp was the latest visitor to our lab, learning the inns and outs of nanopore sequencing under the careful guidance of Ruth.

entry.title: An auspicious day - Jonathan Abebe thesis defence!

link.title: An auspicious day - Jonathan Abebe thesis defence!

entry.content:
Jonathan Abebe, Ph.D.

Today, Jonathan became the first PhD student to graduate from the Depledge Lab! He successfully defended his thesis entitled ‘One RNA at a time – Decoding the (epi-)transcriptomic landscape of viruses’.

Congratulations to Jonathan and thank you to his advisory committee (Kelly Ruggles, Angus Wilson](https://med.nyu.edu/research/wilson-lab/), and Alexander Serganov) and external examiner (David Matthews
entry.summary: Jonathan Abebe, Ph.D. Today, Jonathan became the first PhD student to graduate from the Depledge Lab! He successfully defended his thesis entitled ‘One RNA at a time – Decoding the (epi-)transcriptomic landscape of viruses’. Congratulations to Jonathan and thank you to his advisory committee (Kelly Ruggles, Angus Wilson](https://med.nyu.edu/research/wilson-lab/), and Alexander Serganov) and external examiner (David Matthews

entry.title: Depledge Lab photo - 2024 edition!
And so it begins!
